overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors are private landowners in Genesee County’s rural Oakfield/Elba area, and none have made a public stance on the proposed development. Each has an unknown position regarding the project, and all are considered low in community influence due to the absence of public roles or outspoken activity. Engagement efforts should therefore address general landowner concerns (like farmland use and property impacts) on a personal, trust-building level.

neighbors.name: Brett Jasinski
neighbors.claims: Brett Jasinski’s property lies within a 2,452-acre area of northern Genesee County (Oakfield/Elba) slated for New York’s largest solar farm. He is one of 31 local landowners who have signed long-term lease options with Hecate Energy for the 500-MW "Cider Solar" project on their farmland. There is no record of Jasinski holding any public office or speaking in local meetings on development issues (he is not listed among Genesee County’s town or county officials).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected farming community figure (e.g. Farm Bureau rep) reach out to reassure him about fair lease terms and end-of-project land restoration plans【73】. Emphasize that after the solar project’s lifespan, the land can be returned to agricultural use with minimal lasting impact【61】.

neighbors.name: Makayla Friedl
neighbors.claims: Makayla Friedl is listed as the owner of parcel 12.-1-6.2 in Genesee County, a rural property in an agricultural district. Her name does not appear in local news archives or public meeting records on development, suggesting she has not taken a visible stance on the proposed project. She holds no known civic or leadership positions in the community (not found on any local official rosters).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her in a neighborly conversation highlighting how the project will address farmland preservation and protect property values in the area【75】. Explain the developer’s efforts to minimize long-term impacts and note that nearby residents may be eligible for compensation or benefit programs to ensure fairness【77】.

neighbors.name: Scott Mabon
neighbors.claims: Scott Mabon is the recorded owner of parcel 12.-1-6.12 in Genesee County, indicating he owns land in the same vicinity as Friedl’s parcel in this farming region. No public information links Mabon to any official positions or statements on the project; he has not been noted in media or town minutes regarding local development debates. His involvement in community affairs appears limited to private land ownership, with no reported civic leadership roles.

approach_recommendations.engage: Arrange a one-on-one discussion (through a trusted local official or neighbor) to listen to any concerns he has about losing productive farmland or property impacts【75】. Emphasize plans to minimize disruption and ensure the land’s long-term viability after the project, addressing any questions about how the solar farm will be decommissioned and the land restored【61】.
